properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 1 at 2:42AM MST until March 2 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW AT TIMES WILL IMPACT AREAS ALONG AND
WEST OF THE LARAMIE RANGE SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Some blowing snow possible. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. East winds gusting as high
as 35 mph. Whiteout conditions at times due to heavy
snow...strong winds and blowing snow.

* WHERE...The northern Snowy Range Foothills, including
Interstate 80 northwest of Laramie.

* WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Transportation may be severely impacted with snow
covered roads...blowing snow and very poor visibility. Plan on
slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST MONDAY
